metadata.ttm:title: Exceptions
metadata.ttm:desc: If you recall from the Standard Response section, you were asked whether you are taking Exception to any of the standard Terms and Conditions. If you answered 'Yes' to "Exceptions to Terms and Conditions," you will need to check the list of Contract Clauses provided and select those Regulation(s) for which you are taking Exception by marking the corresponding checkboxes.

div.p: You may recall that a question in the "Standard
Responses" section asked whether you were taking
exception to any terms or conditions.
If you selected "Yes," "Exceptions" becomes
available in the left-hand navigation menu.
The "Exceptions" screen provides you with the
ability to take exceptions to clauses in your
solicitation.
It is through this function that you will be
able to define your exception and include it
in the solicitation response package.
It is important to note that not all clauses may
be negotiated.
If a particular clause does not appear in this
list, then it is not a clause that you may take
exception to.
You may view a clause by clicking on the hyperlink
located in the "Clause Number" column.
Click the checkbox next to the clause(s) that you
would like to take exception to and click the
"Select Regulation(s)" button.
This will take you to the "Exception Text Editor"
screen. We will illustrate the instructions provided for
you here.
First, click the "Clause Number" link to bring up a
PDF of the original text against which you want to
take exception.
Scroll to the portion of the clause you would like
to edit.
Highlight the text desired.
Press "Control -C" on your keyboard, to copy the
text.
Now minimize or close the PDF and return to the
"Exception Text Editor" screen.
Click the "Excerpt from Clause" text box.
Press "Control-V", on your keyboard, to paste the
text you copied.
Click the "Ready to Edit" button.
A message appears warning you that this will update
any Exceptions already Taken or entered.
Press "OK" You will see the same text appear in
the "Exception Text" box.
Edit the "Exception Text" box to reflect the desired
clause change.
When you are satisfied with your exception click
the "Save and Continue" button.
The exception will now display as complete,
signified by a green check in the "Select" column.
You now have the option to edit or delete any
exceptions you have taken.
Likewise, if you would like to add another
exception, select the "clause" checkbox and
click the "Edit Exceptions" button.
If a selected exception is incomplete, a yellow
exclamation point appears in the select column.
To move forward, you must click the edit
"Exceptions" button to complete the exception.
Click the "Save and Continue" button when
complete.
